title: Scholarship Criteria

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Scholarship Criteria
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of scholarships available to VMI Cadets from any source and the selection criteria for those scholarships (needs-based, athletic, merit, or other). There are only a few listed on your website, yet your website and the Alumni Agencies material indicate there are a number of them available, and even for the Alumni Agencies-funded scholarships, VMI makes or participates in the selections. This makes the information releasable under the FOIA.  If there is a website that lists these, I am willing to pull them from there, but unlike almost every other Virginia IHE, VMI does not have an easily locatable source for this information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Obama Presidential Library: Drafts of March 20th 2014 Statement on Ukraine

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all drafts of President Obama's "Statement by the President" on Ukraine that was announced on the White House lawn on March 20th of 2014. Please include a search for all comment drafts, research material, briefing papers, printed emails or text messages related to the statement. Please be sure to include a search of pre-statement emails that transmitted all statement drafts before it was given.

Here's a link to the transcript of the comments:

https://obamawhitehouse.archives.gov/the-press-office/2014/03/20/statement-president-ukraine

Of particular interest is why the statement "This is not our preferred outcome." was included in this statement in relation to the discussion of sanctions targeting the Russian economy.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

Any OD2A performance measure data files or reports transmitted by BPHC to CDC since September 1, 2023.

title: USS Liberty: Convening Authority Order Authorizing Removal of Testimony From US Navy Court of Inquiry Report
tags: israeli attack on the uss liberty

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USS Liberty: Convening Authority Order Authorizing Removal of Testimony From US Navy Court of Inquiry Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the Israel Defense Force attacked our ship on June 8, 1967 and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association. 

Following the attack on our ship, the US Navy convened a Court of Inquiry. 

The “1937 Naval Courts and Boards” contains the rules governing that Court of Inquiry.

Article 58 of the 1937 Naval Courts and Boards states, “The judge advocate, or person officiating as such, shall administer to the members the following oath or affirmation: ‘You do swear (or affirm) well and truly to examine and inquire, according to the evidence, into the matter now before you without partiality.’ After which the president shall administer to the judge advocate or person officiating as such, the following oath or affirmation ‘You do swear (or affirm) truly to record the proceedings of this court and the evidence to be given in the case in hearing.’”

There is no general authorization in the 1930 Articles for testimony to be removed or omitted once given.

Only the convening authority might—if they so order—prevent certain evidence from being included. Critically, that order must itself appear in the record, to maintain transparency about what was excluded and why.

In his appearance before the Court, Lloyd Painter testified he witnessed the deliberate machine-gunning of life rafts we had dropped over the side in anticipation of abandoning ship. This FOIA request includes his sworn statement as an attachment.

According to CINCUSNAVEUR 181105Z JUN67 USS Liberty crewmen testified before the Court they thought the attack was deliberate. CINCUSNAVEUR 181105Z JUN67 is included as an attachment to this FOIA request.

Nowhere in the US Navy Court of Inquiry Report released to the public does Lloyd Painter’s testimony or the crew testimony referenced above appear. 

Nor does the authorization from the convening authority authorizing the removal of the testimony appear.

We request you release to us a copy of the order from the Convening Authority authorizing the removal of testimony given before the US Navy Court of Inquiry into the attack on the USS Liberty, including but not limited to Lloyd Painter’s testimony of his witnessing the deliberate machine gunning of life rafts we had dropped over the side in anticipation of abandoning ship and authorizing the removal of USS Liberty survivor testimony that they thought the attack was deliberate.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records, memos, correspondences (such as emails, faxes, text messages, phone messages) relating to the organizational structure, funding sources, operational philosophy, personnel composition, and legal justification for the Nevada Internet Crimes Against Children Task Force, in relation to the operation announced in a August 15, 2025 press release by the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department, entitled "Eight Child Sex Predators Arrested During Undercover Operation," and in which the following agencies are listed as participants: Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department, Federal Bureau of Investigation, North Las Vegas Police Department, Henderson Police Department, Homeland Security Investigations, and the Nevada Attorney General’s office

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Tracey

title: First Amendment Trainings for Federal Law-Enforcement Officers (Immigration and Customs Enforcement)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any materials or programming (including handouts, slideshows, videos, textbooks, or other media) used in connection with providing training or guidance to law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the following subjects: (a) The First Amendment; (b) protests or demonstrations; (c) freedom of speech or expression; (d) filming police officers. This request is limited to materials used in trainings since January 1, 2020.

2. Any policy concerning whether trainings on the topics mentioned in (1) are mandatory, or regulating the frequency of such trainings.

3. A copy of any document sufficient to show the most recent training conducted for law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the subjects in (1). For example, this could be a receipt or contract for an outside vendor or speaker, or it could be a dated sign-in sheet from the training.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all submissions made through the Board of Education website contact form during the period from July 1, 2024 through the date of this request.

I understand that some submissions may contain information exempt from disclosure (e.g., student education records protected by under state/federal law, or personally identifying information). I respectfully request that any such information be redacted as necessary, rather than withholding the entire record.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

title: Senior Prank Investigation

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Senior Prank Investigation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the investigation of the events of June 3, 2025, referred to as the “senior prank investigation report”, including: 

- The final report regarding the investigation.
- All relevant information gathered during the investigation, as referenced at the Board of Education meeting on August 18, 2025.
- A copy of the email written to Chairperson Fainer regarding the investigation, and any subsequent responses from board member(s) and/or the Chairperson, as referenced at the Board of Education meeting on August 18, 2025.
- Copies of any invoices submitted by attorneys or law firms related to this investigation.

This request specifically seeks the above records, but does not include materials that are exempt from disclosure under the attorney–client privilege as provided in Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-210(b)(10). I ask that, where applicable, any portions deemed privileged be redacted rather than withholding entire records.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Bellford

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have
previously written about the government and its activities, with some reaching
over 100,000 readers in outlets such as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard,
Property of the People, Unicorn Riot, and The Outline, among others. As such,
as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing
skills are well established. In addition, I discuss and comment on the files
online and make them available through non-profits such as the library
Internet Archive and the journalist non-profit MuckRock, disseminating them to
a large audience. While my research is not limited to this, a great deal of
it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the government
itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of
this particular subject in advance. Further, case law states that â€œproof of
the ability to disseminate the released information to a broad cross- section
of the public is not required.â€� Judicial Watch, Inc. v. Depâ€™t of Justice, 365
F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Depâ€™t of Justice, 19 F.
3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified
because it also had â€œfirmâ€� plans to â€œpublish a number of . . . â€˜document
setsâ€™â€� concerning United States foreign and national security policy." Under
this criteria, as well, I qualify as a member of the news media. Additionally,
courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the nature of the
requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be â€œmade
byâ€� a representative of the news media. Id. Â§ 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A
newspaper reporter, for example, is a representative of the news media
regardless of how much interest there is in the story for which he or she is
requesting information." As such, the details of the request itself are moot
for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee category.

Documentation Files

Fee20category20and20search20parameters.pdf

Request Information

request the following records: Records from, mentioning or generated as a

to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial
purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would

prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or

**

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email

include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: Onboarding/offboarding details for Nate Cavanaugh and Jeremy Lewin

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request any records related to the onboarding and possible offboarding of the following two individuals who have worked for the GSA this year, as well as detailing to other agencies:

- Nate Cavanaugh was onboarded on or about February 3 of this year and announced he had resigned from government on August 6th. According to news reports, he had been detailed to multiple agencies in the service of DOGE's activities. I would like to request any SF-50/hiring docs from GSA, including if his position was converted to a different role (or moved from a volunteer to a pay position).
- Jeremy Lewin was hired on or around January 20th. Since then, he has been detailed to several agencies, including USAID and CFPB and has been appointed to positions within both USAID and the Department of State. Nevertheless,  a news report on July 11th indicated that Lewin was still listed in the GSA directory as an employee. Is he still technically an employee of the agency. Is he still detailed to other agencies? He continues to be employed in the federal government.

I would like to request the SF-50s and other onboarding / offboarding details for these two individuals. If possible, I would also like to request any relevant detailing arrangements for these individuals to other agencies by the GSA (or possibly even back to the GSA from other agencies if Jeremy Lewin's employment has ended at GSA but he has been detailed back from USAID or State).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Harris
